result.title: April Fools Challenge
result.content:
Part 1

There will be 9 humorous tasks. Enjoy and good luck!

Tutorial

[problem:212950A]

Spoiler

Every programmer has solved a+b million times :)

[problem:212950B]

Spoiler

Notice "numbers" instead of "integers", plus why do I need to allow some error?

[problem:212950C]

Spoiler

A and B in the title are capital letters!

[problem:212950D]

Spoiler

Where are the capital letters in the problem title? What does it spell? There is a significant hint in the problem statement. Now, how are these two clues linked?

[problem:212950E]

Spoiler

I hope you have picked up the clue about Codeforces Round 372. Refer to samples and you'll see odd and even cases need to be dealt with separately. Finally, the clue about Tony, magic and change refers to the "Magic" feature on Codeforces in January — handle change. The winner was TooDifficuIt, yes, it's I.

[problem:212950F]

Spoiler

Figure out the missing letters. You will find out Caesar cipher does not work, so maybe reverse the string?

[problem:212950G]

Spoiler

A trivial problem. You'll probably want to know the special case is n = 2.

[problem:212950H]

Spoiler

You should have noted the similarity between Go to School by Bus and this task. Do not ignore the wise words of Lai Cheong, so you should have figured out that the only possible time to submit was ... Too bad if you missed it :(

[problem:212950I]

Spoiler

There are English words in the file!

Part 2

There will be 9 humorous tasks. Enjoy and good luck! Tutorial

[problem:213089A]

Hint

Googling something will get you a keyword which links, somehow, to 6 English words.

Perhaps try American tactics in Vietnam war?

[problem:213089B]

Hint

Oooops, I have forgotten to give you any clues. Looks like this task is unsolvable :)

[problem:213089C]

Hint

Just forget about the link. Reading output format is important, you know.

[problem:213089D]

Hint

[problem:213089E]

Hint

[problem:213089F]

Hint

[problem:213089G]

Hint

[problem:213089H]

Hint

[problem:213089I]

Hint
[problem:213089A]
Spoiler

You are supposed to find "Strategic Hamlets" following the clues in the statement. Since there are 5 English words, the natural answer would be "to be or not to be". The "mess" means the order is disrupted. Then, do some exhaustion and you're done.

[problem:213089B]
Spoiler

Oooops, I have forgotten to give you any clues. Looks like this task is unsolvable :)

[problem:213089C]
Spoiler

theultimatepasswordtolifetheuniverseandeverything

[problem:213089D]
Spoiler

Given a specific rating change in contest ID 790, you are to output all users who obtained that rating change. Delta is the symbol for change, so the problem title was a hint to rating change.

[problem:213089E]
Spoiler

Just forget about anagram solvers and reverse the string, oh wait, swap the first two letters as well!

[problem:213089F]
Spoiler

The samples clearly show several letters. By using your anagram solving skills, you should have got the word CENTROID. Now treat the bottom left corner as (0, 0) and output the coordinates of the centroid of all Xs.

[problem:213089G]
Spoiler

Perhaps you would benefit from a technique called binary search on test case? Sometimes it would WA on test 1, sometimes on test 2, hmm... if you tried to output 1, 2, 1e10, 1e10-1 you might be able to observe some pattern.

[problem:213089H]
Spoiler

HR --> HackerRank

Diary + Output format --> Answer is a date

Milestone --> HackerRank's milestone date

What you need is on the HackerRank's Facebook page, which I am sure you liked.

[problem:213089I]
Spoiler

Deleting all spaces, you'll find the length of string is 169. Clearly being a square number is not a coincidence. Arrange them in a 13*13 grid. Notice the last two words \t{rear} and \t{ranger} seem to be concealing \t{rearrange}. Following this clue, you'll find that you should read the grid in a spiraling manner.
